Package propra.imageconverter

Class BaseN

  • java.lang.Object
    • propra.imageconverter.BaseN
  • public class BaseN
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles BaseN (and especially Base32 Hex) encoding.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String alphabet
      ALphabet used for en-/decoding
      private boolean base32Hex
      Switch to identify whether we currently use base-32 hex encoding, or a custom base-n encoding.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description

      Constructs the default Base N Encoder, that encodes in base 32 hex with alphabet 0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUV.

      Constructs the default Base N Encoder, that encodes in base 32 hex with alphabet 0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUV.
      BaseN​(java.lang.String alphabet)
      Constructs a Base N Encoder with custom alphabet.

    • Field Detail

      • alphabet

        private java.lang.String alphabet
        ALphabet used for en-/decoding

      • base32Hex

        private boolean base32Hex
        Switch to identify whether we currently use base-32 hex encoding, or a custom base-n encoding.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseN

        public BaseN​(boolean base32Hex)
      throws InvalidEncodingException
        Constructs the default Base N Encoder, that encodes in base 32 hex with alphabet 0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUV. Has a switch to identify if this should really be base-32 hex encoding, or not. This constructor is mainly used for base-n decoding, because during creation of the object, the alphabet is not already present, and will be set later.
        Parameters:
        base32Hex - define whether this encoding should be Base32 Hex encoding
        Throws:
        InvalidEncodingException - if the length of the alphabet is not a power of two.

      • BaseN

        public BaseN​(java.lang.String alphabet)
      throws InvalidEncodingException
        Constructs a Base N Encoder with custom alphabet.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - alphabet that is used for this encoder.
        Throws:
        InvalidEncodingException - if the length of the alphabet is not a power of two.

      • BaseN

        public BaseN()
      throws InvalidEncodingException
        Constructs the default Base N Encoder, that encodes in base 32 hex with alphabet 0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUV.
        Throws:
        InvalidEncodingException - if the length of the alphabet is not a power of two.

      • setAlphabet

        public void setAlphabet​(java.lang.String alphabet)
                 throws InvalidEncodingException
        Sets the alphabet for en-/decoding.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - alphabet to be set.
        Throws:
        InvalidEncodingException - if the given alphabet has an inappropriate length (length is not a power of two).

      • isBase32Hex

        public boolean isBase32Hex()
        Returns if the encoder is a base-32 hex encoder.
        Returns:
        base32Hex.

      • getAlphabetMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> getAlphabetMap()
        Converts the alphabet into a hash map, which is used for decoding, to identify the index in the alphabet quicker.
        Returns:
        hash map representing alphabet with character as key and index as value.

      • getBits

        public int getBits()
        Returns number of bits that can be represented by one character of the alphabet.
        Returns:
        bits.

      • checkLength

        private boolean checkLength​(int length)
        Checks length of input alphabet.
        Parameters:
        length - length of alphabet.
        Returns:
        true, if if it's a power of two and not greater than 64.

      • getNumOutputCharacter

        private int getNumOutputCharacter​(byte[] bytes)
        Calculates, how many characters will be returned while encoding, depending on the number of input bytes.

        Returns:
        number of output characters.

      • getNumOutputBytes

        private int getNumOutputBytes​(java.lang.String string)
        Calculates, how many bytes will be returned while decoding, depending on the length of input string.
        Parameters:
        string - input string.
        Returns:
        number or output bytes.

      • getMask

        private int getMask()
        Calculates the mask, that is used for encoding. That mask represents the bits in an int, that will be encoded.
        Returns:
        mask used for encoding.
